Name: Abstract Element
Descriptionn:
An element that defines a set of common characteristics that are shared by a group of elements.
  
  An abstract element cannot appear in a document. In a specific implementation of a schema, an abstract element is replaced by a derived element that is itself not an abstract element. The characteristics for the derived element are inherited from the abstract element. 
  
  Appears in the documents in the following form: abstract.

Name: Adapter
Descriptionn:
An optional piece of hardware or software that transforms information provided by a piece of equipment into a form that can be received by an {term:Agent}.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: adapter.

Name: Agent
Descriptionn:
Refers to an MTConnect Agent. 
  
  Software that collects data published from one or more piece(s) of equipment, organizes that data in a structured manner, and responds to requests for data from client software systems by providing a structured response in the form of a {term:Response Document} that is constructed using the {term:semantic data model} defined in the Standard. 
  
  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Agent}.

Name: Application Programming Interface
Descriptionn:
A set of methods to provide communications between software applications.

  The API defined in the MTConnect Standard describes the methods for providing the {term:Request/Response} Information Exchange between an {term:Agent} and client software applications.
  
  Appears in the documents in the following forms: Application Programming Interface or API.

Name: Archetype
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General Description of an {term:MTConnect Asset}*:
  
  Archetype is a class of {term:MTConnect Asset} that provides the requirements, constraints, and common properties for a type of {term:MTConnect Asset}.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: Archetype.

  *ULHEADING:Used as an XML term describing an {term:MTConnect Asset}*:
  
  In an XML representation of the {term:Asset Information Model}, {model:Archetype} is an abstract element that is replaced by a specific type of {term:Asset} Archetype.
  
  Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Archetype}

Name: array3d
Descriptionn: A three dimensional {term:float} array.

Name: arraystring
Descriptionn: An array of {term:string}.

Name: Asset
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

  Typically referred to as an {term:MTConnect Asset}.

  An {term:MTConnect Asset} is something that is used in the manufacturing process, but is not permanently associated with a single piece of equipment, can be removed from the piece of equipment without compromising its function, and can be associated with other pieces of equipment during its lifecycle.

  *ULHEADING:Used to identify a storage area in an {term:Agent}*:

  See description of {term:buffer}.

  *ULHEADING:Used as an {term:Information Model}*:

  Used to describe an {term:Information Model} that contains the rules and terminology that describe information that may be included in electronic documents representing {term:MTConnect Asset}.

  The {term:Asset Information Model} defines the structure for the {term:Assets Response Document}.

  Individual {term:Information Models} describe the structure of the {term:Asset Document} represent each type of {term:MTConnect Asset}. Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Asset Information Model} or (asset type) {term:Information Model}.
  
  *ULHEADING:Used when referring to an {term:MTConnect Asset}*:

  Refers to the information related to an {term:MTConnect Asset} or a group of {term:MTConnect Asset}.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Asset} or {term:Assets}.

  *ULHEADING:Used as an XML container or element*:

  *BEGIN:itemize*
      *ITEM* When used as an XML container that consists of one or more types of {model:Asset} XML elements.
      
      Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Asset}.
      
      *ITEM* When used as an abstract XML element. It is replaced in the XML document by types of {model:Asset} elements representing individual {term:Asset} entities.
      
      Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Asset}.
  *END:itemize*

  *ULHEADING:Used to describe information stored in an {term:Agent}*:

  Identifies an electronic document published by a data source and stored in the {term:assets buffer} of an {term:Agent}.
  
  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Asset Document}.
  
  *ULHEADING:Used as an XML representation of an {term:MTConnect Response Document}*:

  Identifies an electronic document encoded in XML and published by an {term:Agent} in response to a {term:Request} for information from a client software application relating to {term:MTConnect Asset}.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:MTConnectAssets}.

  *ULHEADING:Used as an {term:MTConnect Request}*:

  Represents a specific type of communications request between a client software application and an {term:Agent} regarding {term:MTConnect Asset}.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Asset Request}.

  *ULHEADING:Used as part of an {term:HTTP Request}*:

  Used in the path portion of an {term:HTTP Request Line}, by a client software application, to initiate an {term:Asset Request} to an {term:Agent} to publish an {model:MTConnectAssets} document.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:asset}.

Name: asset buffer
Descriptionn: A buffer or queue for {model:Assets}.

Name: Asset Document
Descriptionn: An electronic document published by an {term:Agent} in response to a {term:Request} for information from a client software application relating to Assets.

Name: Asset Information Model
Descriptionn: It associates each electronic {model:MTConnectAssets} document with a unique identifier and allows for some predefined mechanisms to find, create, request, updated, and delete these electronic documents in a way that provides for consistency across multiple pieces of equipment.

Name: Asset Request
Descriptionn: See {term:Asset}.

Name: Asset Response Document
Descriptionn: See {term:MTConnectAssets Response Document}

Name: Attribute
Descriptionn:
A term that is used to provide additional information or properties for an element.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: attribute.

Name: Base Functional Structure
Descriptionn:
A consistent set of functionalities defined by the MTConnect Standard. This functionality includes the protocol(s) used to communicate data to a client software application, the {term:semantic data model} defining how that data is organized into {term:Response Document}, and the encoding of those {term:Response Document}.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Base Functional Structure}.

Name: boolean
Descriptionn: Boolean data type.

Name: buffer
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

  A section of an {term:Agent} that provides storage for information published from pieces of equipment.

  *ULHEADING:Used relative to {term:Streaming Data}*:

  A section of an {term:Agent} that provides storage for information relating to individual pieces of {term:Streaming Data}. 
  
  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:buffer}.

  *ULHEADING:Used relative to {term:MTConnect Asset}*:

  A section of an {term:Agent} that provides storage for {term:Asset Document}.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:assets buffer}.

Name: normalfont CDATA
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

  An abbreviation for Character Data.

  {term:CDATA} is used to describe a value (text or data) published as part of an XML element.

  For example, *CFONT:"This is some text"* is the {term:CDATA} in the XML element:
  
  *TAB* *CFONT:<Message ...>This is some text</Message>*

  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:CDATA}

Name: Child Element
Descriptionn:
A portion of a data modeling structure that illustrates the relationship between an element and the higher-level {term:Parent Element} within which it is contained.
  
  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Child Element}.

Name: Client
Descriptionn:
A process or set of processes that send {term:Request} for information to an {term:Agent}; e.g. software applications or a function that implements the {term:Request} portion of an {term:Interface} {term:Interaction Model}.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: client.

Name: Component
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

  A {term:Structural Element} that represents a physical or logical part or subpart of a piece of equipment.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Component}.

  *ULHEADING:Used in {term:Information Models}*:

  A data modeling element used to organize the data being retrieved from a piece of equipment.
  
  *BEGIN:itemize*
      *ITEM* When used as an XML container to organize {term:Lower Level} {model:Component} elements. 
      
      Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Components}.
      
      *ITEM* When used as an abstract XML element. {model:Component} is replaced in a data model by a type of {term:Component} element. {model:Component} is also an XML container used to organize {term:Lower Level} {model:Component} elements, {term:Data Entities}, or both.
      
      Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Component}.
  *END:itemize*

Name: Composition
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

  Data modeling elements that describe the lowest level basic structural or functional building blocks contained within a {model:Component} element.

  Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Composition}

  *ULHEADING:Used in {term:Information Models}*:

  A data modeling element used to organize the data being retrieved from a piece of equipment.

  *BEGIN:itemize*
      *ITEM* When used as an XML container to organize {model:Composition} elements. 
      
      Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Compositions}
      
      *ITEM* When used as an abstract XML element. {model:Composition} is replaced in a data model by a type of {term:Composition} element. 
      
      Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Composition}.
  *END:itemize*

Name: Condition
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	An indicator of the health of a piece of equipment or a {term:Component} and its ability to function.

	*ULHEADING:Used as a modeling element*:

	A data modeling element used to organize and communicate information relative to the health of a piece of equipment or {term:Component}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Condition}.

	*ULHEADING:Used in {term:Information Models}*:

	An XML element used to represent {term:Condition} elements.

    *BEGIN:itemize*
	*ITEM* When used as an XML container to organize {term:Lower Level} {model:Condition} elements.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Condition}.

	*ITEM* When used as a {term:Lower Level} element, the form {model:Condition} is an abstract type XML element.  This {term:Lower Level} element is a {term:Data Entity}.  {model:Condition} is replaced in a data model by type of {term:Condition} element.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Condition}.
	*END:itemize*

	*BEGIN:note*
	Note: The form {model:Condition} is used to represent both above uses.
	*END:note*

Name: Controlled Vocabulary
Descriptionn:
A restricted set of values that may be published as the {term:Valid Data Value} for a {term:Data Entity}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Controlled Vocabulary}.

Name: Current Request
Descriptionn: An *GLSTEXT:http* request to the {term:Agent} for returning latest known values for the {model:DataItem} as an {model:MTConnectStreams} *GLSTEXT:xml* document

Name: Current
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	Meaning 1:  A term describing the most recent occurrence of something.

	Meaning 2:  A term used to describe movement; e.g. electric current or air current.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: current

	*ULHEADING:Used in reference to an {term:Agent}*:

	A reference to the most recent information available to an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: current.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an {term:MTConnect Request}*:

	A specific type of communications request between a client software application and an {term:Agent} regarding {term:Streaming Data}.  

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Current Request}.

	*ULHEADING:Used as part of an {term:HTTP Request}*:

	Used in the path portion of an {term:HTTP Request Line}, by a client software application, to initiate a {term:Current Request} to an {term:Agent} to publish an {model:MTConnectStreams} document.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:current}.

Name: data dictionary
Descriptionn:
Listing of standardized terms and definitions used in {term:MTConnect Information Model}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:data dictionary}.

Name: Data Entity
Descriptionn:
A primary data modeling element that represents all elements that either describe data items that may be reported by an {term:Agent} or the data items that contain the actual data published by an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Data Entity}.

Name: Data Item
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	Descriptive information or properties and characteristics associated with a {term:Data Entity}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: data item.

	*ULHEADING:Used in an XML representation of a {term:Data Entity}*:

    *BEGIN:itemize*
	*ITEM* When used as an XML container to organize {model:DataItem} elements.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:DataItems}.

	*ITEM* When used to represent a specific {term:Data Entity}, the form {model:DataItem} is an XML element.  

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:DataItem}.
    *END:itemize*

Name: Data Model
Descriptionn: A {term:semantic data model}.

Name: Data Set
Descriptionn: A set of {term:key-value pairs} where each entry is uniquely identified by the {term:key}.

Name: Data Source
Descriptionn:
Any piece of equipment that can produce data that is published to an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: data source.

Name: Data Streaming
Descriptionn:
A method for an {term:Agent} to provide a continuous stream of information in response to a single {term:Request} from a client software application.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Data Streaming}.

Name: datetime
Descriptionn: DateTime (yyyy-mm-ddthh:mm:ss.ffff) data type.

Name: Deprecated
Descriptionn:
An indication that specific content in an {term:MTConnect Document} is currently usable but is regarded as being obsolete or superseded. It is recommended that deprecated content should be avoided.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: *DEPRECATED*.

Name: Deprecation Warning
Descriptionn:
An indicator that specific content in an {term:MTConnect Document} may be changed to *DEPRECATED* in a future release of the standard.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: *DEPRECATIONWARNING*.

Name: Devices Information Model
Descriptionn:
A set of rules and terms that describes the physical and logical configuration for a piece of equipment and the data that may be reported by that equipment.    

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Devices Information Model}.

Name: Device
Descriptionn:
A part of an information model representing a piece of equipment.  
	
	*ULHEADING:Used in an XML representation of a {term:Response Document}*:

    *BEGIN:itemize*
	*ITEM* When used as an XML container to organize {model:Device} elements.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Devices}.

	*ITEM* When used as an XML container to represent a specific piece of equipment and is composed of a set of {term:Structural Elements} that organize and provide relevance to data published from that piece of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Device}.
	*END:itemize*

Name: Document
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	A piece of written, printed, or electronic matter that provides information.

	*ULHEADING:Used to represent an {term:MTConnect Document}*:

	Refers to printed or electronic document(s) that represent a {term:Part}(s) of the MTConnect Standard.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:MTConnect Document}.

	*ULHEADING:Used to represent a specific representation of an {term:MTConnect Document}*:

	Refers to electronic document(s) associated with an {term:Agent} that are encoded using XML; {term:Response Document} or {term:Asset Document}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:MTConnect XML Document}.

	*ULHEADING:Used to describe types of information stored in an {term:Agent}*:

	In an implementation, the electronic documents that are published from a data source and stored by an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Asset Document}.

	*ULHEADING:Used to describe information published by an {term:Agent}*:

	A document published by an {term:Agent} based upon one of the {term:semantic data model} defined in the MTConnect Standard in response to a request from a client.  

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Response Document}.

Name: Document Body
Descriptionn:
The portion of the content of an {term:MTConnect Response Document} that is defined by the relative {term:MTConnect Information Model}. The {term:Document Body} contains the {term:Structural Elements} and {term:Data Entities} reported in a {term:Response Document}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Document Body}.

Name: Document Header
Descriptionn:
The portion of the content of an {term:MTConnect Response Document} that provides information from an {term:Agent} defining version information, storage capacity, protocol, and other information associated with the management of the data stored in or retrieved from the {term:Agent}.
	
	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Document Header}.

Name: Element
Descriptionn:
Refers to an XML element.

	An XML element is a logical portion of an XML document or schema that begins with a *CFONT:start-tag* and ends with a corresponding *CFONT:end-tag*.  

	The information provided between the *CFONT:start-tag* and *CFONT:end-tag* may contain attributes, other elements (sub-elements), and/or CDATA.

    *BEGIN:note*
	Note:  Also, an XML element may consist of an *CFONT:empty-element tag*.  Refer to *APX:A* for more information on element tags.
    *END:note*
    
	Appears in the documents in the following form: element.

Name: Element Name
Descriptionn:
A descriptive identifier contained in both the *CFONT:start-tag* and *CFONT:end-tag* of an XML element that provides the name of the element.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: element name.

	*ULHEADING:Used to describe the name for a specific XML element*:

	Reference to the name provided in the *CFONT:start-tag*, *CFONT:end-tag*, or *CFONT:empty-element tag* for an XML element.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Element Name}.

Name: Equipment
Descriptionn:
Represents anything that can publish information and is used in the operations of a manufacturing facility shop floor.  Examples of equipment are machine tools, ovens, sensor units, workstations, software applications, and bar feeders.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: equipment or piece of equipment.

Name: Equipment Metadata
Descriptionn: See {term:Metadata}

Name: Error Information Model
Descriptionn:
The rules and terminology that describes the {term:Response Document} returned by an {term:Agent} when it encounters an error while interpreting a {term:Request} for information from a client software application or when an {term:Agent} experiences an error while publishing the {term:Response} to a {term:Request} for information.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Error Information Model}.

Name: Event
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	The occurrence of something that happens or takes place.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: event.

	*ULHEADING:Used as a type of {term:Data Entity}*:

	An identification that represents a change in state of information associated with a piece of equipment or an occurrence of an action.  Event also provides a means to publish a message from a piece of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Event}.

	*ULHEADING:Used as a {model:category} attribute for a {term:Data Entity}*:

	Used as a value for the {model:category} attribute for an XML {model:DataItem} element.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:EVENT}.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an XML container or element*:

    *BEGIN:itemize*
	*ITEM* When used as an XML container that consists of one or more types of {model:Event} XML elements.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Events}.

	*ITEM* When used as an abstract XML element.  It is replaced in the XML document by types of {model:Event} elements.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Event}.
    *END:itemize*

Name: Extensible
Descriptionn: The ability for an implementer to extend {term:MTConnect Information Model} by adding content not currently addressed in the MTConnect Standard.

Name: Fault State
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, a term that indicates the reported status of a {term:Condition} category {term:Data Entity}.   

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Fault State}.

Name: float
Descriptionn: Float data type.

Name: Header
Descriptionn: See {term:Document Header}

Name: heartbeat
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	A function that indicates to a client application that the communications connection to an {term:Agent} is still viable during times when there is no new data available to report  often referred to as a "keep alive" message.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:heartbeat}.

	*ULHEADING:When used as part of an {term:HTTP Request}*:

	The form {model:heartbeat} is used as a parameter in the query portion of an {term:HTTP Request Line}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:heartbeat}.

Name: Higher Level
Descriptionn: A nested element that is above a lower level element.

Name: normalfont HTTP
Descriptionn:
Hyper-Text Transport Protocol.  The protocol used by all web browsers and web applications.

    *BEGIN:note*
	Note:  HTTP is an IETF standard and is defined in RFC 7230. \ See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7230 for more information.
	*END:note*

Name: HTTP Body
Descriptionn: {term:HTTP Body} is the data bytes transmitted in an HTTP transaction message immediately following the headers.

Name: HTTP Error Message
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, a response provided by an {term:Agent} indicating that an {term:HTTP Request} is incorrectly formatted or identifies that the requested data is not available from the {term:Agent}.  

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:HTTP Error Message}.

Name: HTTP Header
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, the content of the {term:Header} portion of either an {term:HTTP Request} from a client software application or an {term:HTTP Response} from an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:HTTP Header}.

Name: HTTP Header Field
Descriptionn: {term:HTTP Header Field} are components of the header section of request and response messages in an HTTP transaction.

Name: HTTP Messaging
Descriptionn: {term:HTTP Messaging} is an interface for information exchange functionality.

Name: HTTP Method
Descriptionn: In the MTConnect Standard, a portion of a command in an {term:HTTP Request} that indicates the desired action to be performed on the identified resource; often referred to as verbs.

Name: HTTP Request
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, a communications command issued by a client software application to an {term:Agent} requesting information defined in the {term:HTTP Request Line}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:HTTP Request}.

Name: HTTP Request Line
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, the first line of an {term:HTTP Request} describing a specific {term:Response Document} to be published by an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:HTTP Request Line}.

Name: HTTP Request Method
Descriptionn: It indicates the method to be performed on the resource identified by the given request URI.

Name: HTTP Request URL
Descriptionn: A request specifying the location and mechanism to retrieve a web resource.

Name: HTTP Response
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, the information published from an {term:Agent} in reply to an {term:HTTP Request}.  An {term:HTTP Response} may be either a {term:Response Document} or an {term:HTTP Error Message}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:HTTP Response}.

Name: HTTP Server
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, a software program that accepts {term:HTTP Request} from client software applications and publishes {term:HTTP Response} as a reply to those {term:Request}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:HTTP Server}.

Name: HTTP Status Code
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, a numeric code contained in an {term:HTTP Response} that defines a status category associated with the {term:Response}  either a success status or a category of an HTTP error.  

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:HTTP Status Code}.

Name: HTTP Version
Descriptionn: Version of the HTTP protocol.

Name: id
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	An identifier used to distinguish a piece of information.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: id.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an XML attribute*:

	When used as an attribute for an XML element - {term:Structural Element}, {term:Data Entity}, or {term:Asset}.  {model:id} provides a unique identity for the element within an XML document.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:id}.

Name: Implementation
Descriptionn: A specific instantiation of the MTConnect Standard.

Name: Information Model
Descriptionn:
The rules, relationships, and terminology that are used to define how information is structured.

	For example, an information model is used to define the structure for each {term:MTConnect Response Document}; the definition of each piece of information within those documents and the relationship between pieces of information.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Information Model}.

Name: instance
Descriptionn:
Describes a set of {term:Streaming Data} in an {term:Agent}.  Each time an {term:Agent} is restarted with an empty {term:buffer}, data placed in the {term:buffer} represents a new {term:instance} of the {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:instance}.

Name: integer
Descriptionn: Integer data type.

Name: Interaction Model
Descriptionn:
The definition of information exchanged to support the interactions between pieces of equipment collaborating to complete a task.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Interaction Model}.

Name: Interface
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	The exchange of information between pieces of equipment and/or software systems.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: interface.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an {term:Interaction Model}*:

	An {term:Interaction Model} that describes a method for inter-operations between pieces of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Interface}.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an XML container or element*:

	*TAB* - When used as an XML container that consists of one or more types of {model:Interface} XML elements.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Interfaces}.

	*TAB* - When used as an abstract XML element.  It is replaced in the XML document by types of {model:Interface} elements.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Interface}

Name: interfaces
Descriptionn: *CITETITLE:MTCPart5* provides an interaction model for coordinating activities between manufacturing devices

Name: key-value pair
Descriptionn: An association between an identifier referred to as the {term:key} and a value which taken together create a {term:key-value pair}. When used in a set of {term:key-value pairs} each {term:key} is unique and will only have one value associated with it at any point in time.

Name: Lower Camel Case
Descriptionn: the first word is lowercase and the remaining words are capitalized and all spaces between words are removed.

Name: Lower Level
Descriptionn: A nested element that is below a higher level element.

Name: major
Descriptionn: Identifier representing a consistent set of functionalities defined by the MTConnect Standard.

Name: Message
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	The content of a communication process.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: message.

	*ULHEADING:Used relative to an {term:Agent}*:

	Describes the information that is exchanged between an {term:Agent} and a client software application.  A {term:Message} may contain either a {term:Request} from a client software application or a {term:Response} from an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Message}.

	*ULHEADING:Used as a type of {term:Data Entity}*:

	Describes a type of {term:Data Entity} in the {term:Devices Information Model} that can contain any text string of information or native code to be transferred from a piece of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:MESSAGE}.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an Element Name*:

	An {term:Element Name} for a {term:Data Entity} in the {term:Streams Information Model} that can contain any text string of information or native code to be transferred from a piece of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form:  *GLSELEMENTNAME:message event*.

Name: Metadata
Descriptionn:
Data that provides information about other data.

	For example, {term:Equipment Metadata} defines both the {term:Structural Elements} that represent the physical and logical parts and sub-parts of each piece of equipment, the relationships between those parts and sub-parts, and the definitions of the {term:Data Entities} associated with that piece of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Metadata} or {term:Equipment Metadata}.

Name: minor
Descriptionn: Identifier representing a specific set of functionalities defined by the MTConnect Standard.

Name: MODBUS
Descriptionn: Modbus is a communication protocol developed by Modicon systems and is a method used for transmitting information over serial lines between electronic devices.

Name: MTConnect
Descriptionn: The name of the standard.

Name: MTConnect Agent
Descriptionn: See definition for {term:Agent}.

Name: MTConnect Asset
Descriptionn: See {term:Asset}

Name: MTConnect Document
Descriptionn: See {term:Document}.

Name: MTConnect Information Model
Descriptionn: See {term:Information Model}

Name: MTConnect Request
Descriptionn:
A communication request for information issued from a client software application to an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:MTConnect Request}.

Name: MTConnect Response Document
Descriptionn: See {term:Response Document}.

Name: MTConnect Standard
Descriptionn: The name of the standard.

Name: MTConnect XML Document
Descriptionn: See {term:Document}.

Name: MTConnectAssets Response Document
Descriptionn:
An electronic document published by an {term:Agent} in response to a {term:Request} for information from a client software application relating to {term:MTConnect Asset}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:MTConnectAssets Response Document}.

Name: MTConnectDevices Response Document
Descriptionn:
An electronic document published by an {term:Agent} in response to a {term:Request} for information from a client software application that includes {term:Metadata} for one or more pieces of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:MTConnectDevices Response Document}.

Name: MTConnectErrors Response Document
Descriptionn:
An electronic document published by an {term:Agent} whenever it encounters an error while interpreting a {term:Request} for information from a client software application or when an {term:Agent} experiences an error while publishing the {term:Response} to a {term:Request} for information.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:MTConnectErrors Response Document}.

Name: MTConnectStreams Response Document
Descriptionn:
An electronic document published by an {term:Agent} in response to a {term:Request} for information from a client software application that includes {term:Streaming Data} from the {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:MTConnectStreams Response Document}.

Name: namespace
Descriptionn: {term:namespace} are used to organize code into logical groups.

Name: normalfont NMTOKEN
Descriptionn:
The data type for XML identifiers.

	*BEGIN:note*
	Note: The identifier must start with a letter, an underscore "_" or a colon.  The next character must be a letter, a number, or one of the following ".", "-", "_", ":".  The identifier must not have any spaces or special characters.
	*END:note*

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:NMTOKEN}.

Name: Occurrence
Descriptionn: Occurrence defines the number of times the content defined in the tables *MAY* be provided in the usage case specified

Name: ontology
Descriptionn: logical structure of the terms used to describe a domain of knowledge, including both the definitions of the applicable terms and their relationships ISO 20534:2018

Name: parameter
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General Meaning*:

	A variable that must be given a value during the execution of a program or a communications command.

	*ULHEADING:When used as part of an {term:HTTP Request}*:

	Represents the content (keys and associated values) provided in the {term:Query} portion of an {term:HTTP Request Line} that identifies specific information to be returned in a {term:Response Document}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: parameter.

Name: Parent Element
Descriptionn:
An XML element used to organize {term:Lower Level} child elements that share a common relationship to the {term:Parent Element}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Parent Element}.

Name: Part
Descriptionn: Each Standard document is referred to as a {term:Part} of the Standard.

Name: Pascal Case
Descriptionn: The first letter of each word is capitalized and the remaining letters are in lowercase. All space is removed between letters

Name: Persistence
Descriptionn: A method for retaining or restoring information.

Name: Physical Connection
Descriptionn: The network transmission technologies that physically interconnect an {term:Agent}.

Name: Probe Request
Descriptionn: An *GLSTEXT:http* request to the {term:Agent} for returning metadata as an {model:MTConnectDevices} *GLSTEXT:xml* document

Name: Probe
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning of a physical entity*:

	An instrument commonly used for measuring the physical geometrical characteristics of an object.

    *BEGIN:itemize*
	*ITEM* *ULHEADING:Used to describe a measurement device*:

	The form probe is used to define a measurement device that provides position information.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: probe. 

	*ITEM* *ULHEADING:Used within a {term:Data Entity}*:

	The form {model:PROBE} is used to designate a subtype for the {term:Data Entity} {model:PATH_POSITION} indicating a measurement position relating to a probe unit.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:PROBE}.
    *END:itemize*

	*ULHEADING:General meaning for communications with an {term:Agent}*:

	Probe is used to define a type of communication request. 

    *BEGIN:itemize*
	*ITEM* *ULHEADING:Used as a type of communication request*:

	The form {term:Probe Request} represents a specific type of communications request between a client software application and an {term:Agent} regarding {term:Metadata} for one or more pieces of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Probe Request}.

	*ITEM* *ULHEADING:Used in an {term:HTTP Request Line}*:

	The form {model:probe} is used to designate a {term:Probe Request} in the *CFONT:<Path>* portion of an {term:HTTP Request Line}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:probe}.
    *END:itemize*

Name: Protocol
Descriptionn: A set of rules that allow two or more entities to transmit information from one to the other.

Name: Publish
Descriptionn: Sending of messages in a {term:Publish/Subscribe} pattern.

Name: Publish/Subscribe
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, a communications messaging pattern that may be used to publish {term:Streaming Data} from an {term:Agent}.  When a {term:Publish/Subscribe} communication method is established between a client software application and an {term:Agent}, the {term:Agent} will repeatedly publish a specific {model:MTConnectStreams} document at a defined period.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Publish/Subscribe}.

Name: Query
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General Meaning*:

	A portion of a request for information that more precisely defines the specific information to be published in response to the request. 

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Query}.

	*ULHEADING:Used in an {term:HTTP Request Line}*:

	The form {model:query} includes a string of parameters that define filters used to refine the content of a {term:Response Document} published in response to an {term:HTTP Request}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:query}.

Name: Realization
Descriptionn: Realization is a specialized abstraction relationship between two sets of model elements, one representing a specification (the supplier) and the other represents an implementation of the latter (the client). Realization can be used to model stepwise refinement, optimizations, transformations, templates, model synthesis, framework composition, etc.

Name: Reference
Descriptionn: {model:Reference} is a pointer to information that is associated with another {term:Structural Element}.

Name: Request
Descriptionn:
A communications method where a client software application transmits a message to an {term:Agent}.  That message instructs the {term:Agent} to respond with specific information.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Request}.

Name: Requester
Descriptionn:
An entity that initiates a {term:Request} for information in a communications exchange.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Requester}.

Name: Request/Response
Descriptionn:
A communications pattern that supports the transfer of information between an {term:Agent} and a client software application. In a {term:Request/Response} information exchange, a client software application requests specific information from an {term:Agent}. An {term:Agent} responds to the {term:Request} by publishing a {term:Response Document}.   

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Request/Response}.

Name: reset
Descriptionn: A reset is associated with an occurrence of a {term:Data Entity} indicated by the \{model:resetTriggered} attribute. When a reset occurs, the accumulated value or statistic are reverted back to their initial value. A {term:Data Entity} with a {term:Data Set} representation removes all {term:key-value pairs}, setting the {term:Data Set} to an empty set.

Name: Responder
Descriptionn:
An entity that responds to a {term:Request} for information in a communications exchange.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Responder}.

Name: Response
Descriptionn: A response {term:Interface} which responds to a {term:Request}.

Name: Response Document
Descriptionn: See {term:Document}.

Name: normalfont REST
Descriptionn:
Stands for REpresentational State Transfer:  A software architecture where a client software application and server move through a series of state transitions based solely on the request from the client and the response from the server. 

	Appears in the documents in the following form: REST.

Name: revision
Descriptionn: A supplemental identifier representing only organizational or editorial changes to a {term:minor} version document with no changes in the functionality described in that document.

Name: Root Element
Descriptionn:
The first {term:Structural Element} provided in a {term:Response Document} encoded using XML.  The {term:Root Element} is an XML container and is the {term:Parent Element} for all other XML elements in the document.  The {term:Root Element} appears immediately following the XML Declaration.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Root Element}.

Name: Sample Request
Descriptionn: A request from the {term:Agent} for a stream of time series data.

Name: Sample
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	The collection of one or more pieces of information.  

	*ULHEADING:Used when referring to the collection of information*:

	When referring to the collection of a piece of information from a data source.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: sample.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an {term:MTConnect Request}*:

	When representing a specific type of communications request between a client software application and an {term:Agent} regarding {term:Streaming Data}.  

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Sample Request}.

	*ULHEADING:Used as part of an {term:HTTP Request}*:

	Used in the {model:path} portion of an {term:HTTP Request Line}, by a client software application, to initiate a {term:Sample Request} to an {term:Agent} to publish an {model:MTConnectStreams} document.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:sample}.

	*ULHEADING:Used to describe a {term:Data Entity}*:

	Used to define a specific type of {term:Data Entity}.  A {term:Sample} type {term:Data Entity} reports the value for a continuously variable or analog piece of information.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Sample} or {term:Samples}.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an XML container or element*:

    *BEGIN:itemize*
	*ITEM* When used as an XML container that consists of one or more types of Sample XML elements.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Samples}.

	*ITEM* When used as an abstract XML element.  It is replaced in the XML document by types of {model:Sample} elements representing individual {term:Sample} type of {term:Data Entity}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Sample}.
    *END:itemize*

Name: schema
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	The definition of the structure, rules, and vocabularies used to define the information published in an electronic document.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: schema.

	*ULHEADING:Used in association with an {term:MTConnect Response Document}*:

	Identifies a specific schema defined for an {term:MTConnect Response Document}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:schema}.

Name: semantic data model
Descriptionn:
A methodology for defining the structure and meaning for data in a specific logical way.  

	It provides the rules for encoding electronic information such that it can be interpreted by a software system.  

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:semantic data model}.

Name: sensing element
Descriptionn: A mechanism that provides a signal or measured value.

Name: sensor element
Descriptionn: A {term:sensor element} provides a signal or measured value.

Name: Sensor
Descriptionn: A {term:Sensor} is typically comprised of two major components: a {term:sensor unit} that provides signal processing, conversion, and communications and the {term:sensing elements} that provides a signal or measured value.

Name: sensor unit
Descriptionn: A {term:sensor unit} provides signal processing, conversion, and communications.

Name: sequence number
Descriptionn:
The primary key identifier used to manage and locate a specific piece of {term:Streaming Data} in an {term:Agent}.

	{term:sequence number} is a monotonically increasing number within an instance of an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:sequence number}.

Name: Standard
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	A document established by consensus that provides rules, guidelines, or characteristics for activities or their results (as defined in ISO/IEC Guide 2:2004).

	*ULHEADING:Used when referring to the MTConnect Standard*: 

	The MTConnect Standard is a standard that provides the definition and semantic data structure for information published by pieces of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: Standard or MTConnect Standard.

Name: Streaming Data
Descriptionn:
The values published by a piece of equipment for the {term:Data Entities} defined by the {term:Equipment Metadata}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Streaming Data}.

Name: Streams Information Model
Descriptionn:
The rules and terminology ({term:semantic data model}) that describes the {term:Streaming Data} returned by an {term:Agent} from a piece of equipment in response to a {term:Sample Request} or a {term:Current Request}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Streams Information Model}.

Name: string
Descriptionn: String data type.

Name: Structural Element
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	An XML element that organizes information that represents the physical and logical parts and sub-parts of a piece of equipment.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Structural Element}.

	*ULHEADING:Used to indicate hierarchy of Components*:

	When used to describe a primary physical or logical construct within a piece of equipment. 

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Top Level} {term:Structural Element}.

	When used to indicate a {term:Child Element} which provides additional detail describing the physical or logical structure of a {term:Top Level} {term:Structural Element}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Lower Level} {term:Structural Element}.

Name: Subscribe
Descriptionn: Receiving messages in a {term:Publish/Subscribe} pattern.

Name: subtype
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	A secondary or subordinate type of categorization or classification of information.

	In software and data modeling, a subtype is a type of data that is related to another higher-level type of data.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: subtype.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an attribute for a {term:Data Entity}*:

	Used as an attribute that provides a sub-categorization for the {model:type} attribute for a piece of information.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:subType}.

Name: Time Series
Descriptionn: A {model:DataItem} representation of a contiguous vector of values supporting high frequency data rates

Name: time stamp
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	The best available estimate of the time that the value(s) for published or recorded information was measured or determined.

	Appears in the documents as "time stamp".

	*ULHEADING:Used as an attribute for recorded or published data*:

	An attribute that identifies the time associated with a {term:Data Entity} as stored in an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:timestamp}.

Name: Top Level
Descriptionn: {term:Structural Elements} that represent the most significant physical or logical functions of a piece of equipment.

Name: Transport Protocol
Descriptionn: A set of capabilities that provide the rules and procedures used to transport information between an {term:Agent} and a client software application through a {term:Physical Connection}.

Name: type
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	A classification or categorization of information.

	In software and data modeling, a type is a grouping function to identify pieces of information that share common characteristics. 

	Appears in the documents in the following form: type.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an attribute for a {term:Data Entity}*:

	Used as an attribute that provides a categorization for piece of information that share common characteristics.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:type}.

Name: normalfont URI
Descriptionn:
Stands for Universal Resource Identifier.  

	See http://www.w3.org/TR/uri-clarification/#RFC3986

Name: normalfont URN
Descriptionn:
Stands for Uniform Resource Name.  

	See http://www.w3.org/TR/uri-clarification/#RFC3986

Name: normalfont UTC/GMT
Descriptionn:
Stands for Coordinated Universal Time/Greenwich Mean Time.  

	UTC/GMT is the primary time standard by which the world regulates clocks and time.

	The time stamp for all information reported in an {term:MTConnect Response Document} is provided in UTC/GMT format.

Name: normalfont UUID
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	Stands for Universally Unique Identifier. (Can also be referred to as a GUID in some literature  Globally Unique Identifier).

	*BEGIN:note*
	Note:  Defined in RFC 4122 of the IETF.  See https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4122.txt for more information.
	*END:note*

	Appears in the documents in the following form: UUID.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an attribute for an XML element*:

	Used as an attribute that provides a unique identity for a piece of information reported by an {term:Agent}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:uuid}.

Name: Valid Data Value
Descriptionn:
One or more acceptable values or constrained values that can be reported for a {term:Data Entity}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:Valid Data Value}(s).

Name: normalfont W3C
Descriptionn:
Stands for World Wide Web Consortium.

	W3C is an international community of organizations and the public work together to develop internet standards.  

	W3C Standards are used as a guide within the MTConnect Standard.

Name: WARNING
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General Meaning*:

	A statement or action that indicates a possible danger, problem, or other unexpected situation.

	*ULHEADING:Used relative to changes in an {term:MTConnect Document}*:

	Used to indicate that specific content in an {term:MTConnect Document} may be changed in a future release of the standard.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: *WARNING*.

	*ULHEADING:Used as a {term:Valid Data Value} for a {term:Condition}*:

	Used as a {term:Valid Data Value} for a {term:Condition} type {term:Data Entity}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:WARNING}.

	*ULHEADING:Used as an {term:Element Name} for a {term:Data Entity}*:

	Used as the {term:Element Name} for a {term:Condition} type {term:Data Entity} in an {term:MTConnectStreams Response Document}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {model:Warning}.

Name: normalfont XML
Descriptionn:
Stands for eXtensible Markup Language. 

	XML defines a set of rules for encoding documents that both a human-readable and machine-readable.

	XML is the language used for all code examples in the MTConnect Standard.

	Refer to http://www.w3.org/XML for more information about XML.

Name: XML Container
Descriptionn:
In the MTConnect Standard, a type of XML element.

	An XML container is used to organize other XML elements that are logically related to each other.   A container may have either {term:Data Entities} or other {term:Structural Elements} as {term:Child Elements}.

Name: XML Declaration
Descriptionn: It is a processing instruction that identifies the document as being XML.

Name: XML Document
Descriptionn:
An XML document is a structured text file encoded using XML.

	An XML document is an instantiation of an XML schema.  It has a single root XML element, conforms to the XML specification, and is structured based upon a specific schema.

	{term:MTConnect Response Document} may be encoded as an XML document.

Name: XML Schema
Descriptionn: In the MTConnect Standard, an instantiation of a schema defining a specific document encoded in XML.

Name: normalfont XPath
Descriptionn:
*ULHEADING:General meaning*:

	{term:XPath} is a command structure that describes a way for a software system to locate information in an XML document.  

	{term:XPath} uses an addressing syntax based on a path through the document's logical structure. 

	See http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath for more information on {term:XPath}.

	Appears in the documents in the following form: {term:XPath}.
